analyzed: gang la chad bsam rtag pa'i blo dang gzung dang 'dzin pa yod min pa //

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen yum shes rab pha rol phyin ma de la mgos phyag 'tshal //

original: gzung dang 'dzin las nges grol zhing //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin las nges grol zhing //

analyzed: rtag dang chad pa rnam spangs pa // kun mkhyen skyes yum shes rab kyi //
translated: free from eternalism and nihilism,🔽the mother of the omniscient ones,

original: pha rol phyin ma la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: pha rol phyin ma la phyag 'tshal //
translated: the perfection of wisdom, I pay homage.

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: The master Dignāga composed the following:

original: shes rab pha rol phyin zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is called the mother,🔽and the skillful means are called the father.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsdus pa'i bshad pa blo chung ba rnams dran pa'i don du mdor bsdus te bdag gis bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsdus pa'i bshad pa blo chung ba rnams dran pa'i don du mdor bsdus te bdag gis bya'o //
translated: For the sake of those of little intelligence, I will compose a brief commentary on the Compendium of the Perfection of Wisdom, in order to refresh their memory.

original: 'di ltar 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: In this way, what is it that the bodhisattvas should accomplish?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub par bya ba yin zhing bskyed par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub par bya ba yin zhing bskyed par bya ba yin te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is what should be accomplished and generated,

original: gang gi phyir de nyid 'bras bu nyid du mngon par 'dod pa yin no //🔽de bzhin du brgyad stong pa la sogs pa'i /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid 'bras bu nyid du mngon par 'dod pa yin no // de bzhin du brgyad stong pa la sogs pa'i /
translated: because it is precisely that which is manifestly desired as the result.🔽Similarly, the collections of scriptures of the perfection of wisdom, such as the Astasāhasrikā,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzhung gi tshogs rnams kyis bsgrub par bya yang 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzhung gi tshogs rnams kyis bsgrub par bya yang 'di nyid yin no //
translated: are also what should be accomplished.

original: gang la bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgras don gang zhig brjod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgras don gang zhig brjod pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the word perfection of wisdom, which is to be accomplished?

original: de'i phyir brjod pa gnyis med ye shes zhes bya ba la gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod pa gnyis med ye shes zhes bya ba la gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “the nondual knowledge.” The two are said to be the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: shes pa gang la gnyis yod pa ma yin pa de ni gnyis med do //
analyzed: shes pa gang la gnyis yod pa ma yin pa de ni gnyis med do //
translated: The knowledge in which there is no duality is nondual.

original: de la gzung ba ni gzugs la sogs pa ji ltar rnam par gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la gzung ba ni gzugs la sogs pa ji ltar rnam par gnas pa rnams so //
translated: Therein, the apprehended object is the various forms, etc.

original: 'dzin pa de ni der snang ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa de ni der snang ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: The apprehending subject is the knowledge appearing as that.

original: de bas na 'dis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gis dben pa'i shes pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gis dben pa'i shes pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is said: the perfection of wisdom is the knowledge devoid of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: gang gi phyir shes rab thos pa dang bsams pa la sogs pa'i rab ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes rab thos pa dang bsams pa la sogs pa'i rab ste /
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom is the culmination of hearing, reflection, etc.

original: mthar thug par phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin la /
analyzed: mthar thug par phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin la /
translated: The culmination of the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de yang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, this is a very pure realization.

original: gal @295b te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba yin na 'on de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal @295b te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba yin na 'on de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If the perfection of wisdom itself is what is to be accomplished by the bodhisattvas, then it would not be the Tathagata.

original: 'bad pa 'di thams cad ni sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i don du yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'bad pa 'di thams cad ni sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i don du yin no zhe na /
translated: But all this effort is for the sake of attaining buddhahood.

original: de'i phyir brjod pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs /
translated: That is the Tathagata.

original: rtogs pa'i dra ba ma lus pa dang bral ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dra ba ma lus pa dang bral ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom, free from the entire net of conceptualization, is the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin nyid gsungs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gsungs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa yin te /
translated: He is called the Tathagata because he speaks of thusness.

original: de gnyis kyang tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: And those two are not different.

original: 'dis ni de bzhin nyid las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni de bzhin nyid las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan ma yin la /
translated: By this, the perfection of wisdom is not different from thusness,

original: de yang de las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang de las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: and it is not different from that.

original: 'on kyang sgron ma dang 'od bzhin du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgron ma dang 'od bzhin du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di brjod pa yin no //
translated: But it is like a lamp and its light.

original: don gyi de kho na nyid 'di las bsams nas gzhan du blo'i nor can rnams kyis /🔽stong nyid ces bya shes pa las //
analyzed: don gyi de kho na nyid 'di las bsams nas gzhan du blo'i nor can rnams kyis / stong nyid ces bya shes pa las //
translated: Thinking of this reality, others who are rich in intellect🔽say that emptiness is nothing other than

original: gzhan ni 'ga' yang yod min te //🔽gang phyir dben pa dben gyur las //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'ga' yang yod min te // gang phyir dben pa dben gyur las //
translated: consciousness.🔽Because it is not different from what is void,

original: tha mi dad pa nyid du 'dod //🔽de ltar min na gnyis stong pa //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa nyid du 'dod // de ltar min na gnyis stong pa //
translated: it is held to be the same as what is void.🔽If it were not so,

original: rnam shes min par thal 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: rnam shes min par thal 'gyur zhing //
translated: emptiness would not be consciousness.

original: gnyis med pa las log pa ni //
analyzed: gnyis med pa las log pa ni //
translated: And what is the opposite of nonduality

original: gnyis kyi bdag tu thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis kyi bdag tu thal bar 'gyur //
translated: would be the self of duality.

original: de gyur de bzhin nyid rang bzhin //
analyzed: de gyur de bzhin nyid rang bzhin //
translated: And that would be the nature of reality

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid yin par brjod //🔽rig bya rig byed dngos po ni //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid yin par brjod // rig bya rig byed dngos po ni //
translated: and would be the Lord himself.🔽The object of knowledge and the knower

original: rnam shes nyid la yang dag brten //
analyzed: rnam shes nyid la yang dag brten //
translated: are truly based on consciousness.

original: zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what they say.

original: de lta na gzhung dang lam dag la ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par bsnyad ces dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: de lta na gzhung dang lam dag la ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par bsnyad ces dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: In that case, how can the scriptures and the path be called the perfection of wisdom?

original: bsgrub bya don de dang ldan pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bsgrub bya don de dang ldan pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: The meaning of perfection is that which is endowed with that object to be accomplished.

original: gzhung dang lam dag la de'i sgra ste /
analyzed: gzhung dang lam dag la de'i sgra ste /
translated: The word is in the scriptures and paths.

original: der nye bar bsnyad pa ni gang gi phyir gzhung dang lam de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i do dang ldan pa de'i dgongs pa can yin te /
analyzed: der nye bar bsnyad pa ni gang gi phyir gzhung dang lam de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i do dang ldan pa de'i dgongs pa can yin te /
translated: The explanation is that because those scriptures and paths are endowed with the perfection of wisdom, they are intended for that.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the method. This is the meaning.

original: des na de dag la de'i sgra yin te /
analyzed: des na de dag la de'i sgra yin te /
translated: Therefore, that is the word for them.

original: sbyang gi nang du gnas pa'i sa bon bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyang gi nang du gnas pa'i sa bon bzhin no //
translated: Like a seed that is in the ground.

original: des na 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgra'i don rnam pa gnyis su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgra'i don rnam pa gnyis su bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this teaches the two kinds of meanings of the word perfection of wisdom.

original: gtso bo dang phal pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo dang phal pa'o //
translated: The primary and the ordinary.

original: de la gtso bo ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la gtso bo ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Among them, the primary is the characteristic of nondual wisdom.

original: phal pa ni gzhung dang lam gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: phal pa ni gzhung dang lam gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The ordinary is the nature of scriptures and paths.

original: des na de ltar dgongs pa brjod nas /
analyzed: des na de ltar dgongs pa brjod nas /
translated: Therefore, having thus explained the intention,

original: rten dang zhes @296a * //
analyzed: rten dang zhes @296a * //
translated: The basis and...

original: bya ba la sogs pas brjod par bya ba'i don 'chad do //🔽'dir yang brjod par bya ba'i don ni sum cu rtsa gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pas brjod par bya ba'i don 'chad do // 'dir yang brjod par bya ba'i don ni sum cu rtsa gnyis kho na ste /
translated: The meaning of the expression is explained by the words “activity, etc.”

original: lhag pa ma yin mchog pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa ma yin mchog pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of the expression is just thirty-two, neither more nor less.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba bcu dang / stong pa nyid rnam pa bcu drug dang / rten dang dbang du bya ba dang las dang rtags dang / nyes dmigs dang phan yon zhes bya ba gzhan rnam pa drug go //🔽de la rten ni ston pa po bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba bcu dang / stong pa nyid rnam pa bcu drug dang / rten dang dbang du bya ba dang las dang rtags dang / nyes dmigs dang phan yon zhes bya ba gzhan rnam pa drug go // de la rten ni ston pa po bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas te /
translated: There are ten kinds of distraction of conceptualization, sixteen kinds of emptiness, and six other kinds of emptiness, called “basis, mastery, function, sign, disadvantage, and benefit.”

original: gang gi phyir de nyid zab mo ston pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de'i phyir rten yin no //🔽gal te rab 'byor la sogs pa yang ston pa por gyur pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid zab mo ston pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de'i phyir rten yin no // gal te rab 'byor la sogs pa yang ston pa por gyur pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: The basis is the teacher, the Lord Buddha, because he is the reason for the teaching of the profound.

original: des na de yang rten du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de yang rten du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If Subhūti and others are also teachers, then they too would be the basis.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nges par 'byung bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams te ston cig ces gsungs pa yin no zhe na
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nges par 'byung bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams te ston cig ces gsungs pa yin no zhe na
translated: Thus, the Lord himself said, “Teach the perfection of wisdom, beginning with the perfection of wisdom, in such a way that the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas will be liberated.”

original: / gal te de lta yin du zin pa de lta na yang de dag rnams kyi nus pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mthu nyid kyis yin par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: / gal te de lta yin du zin pa de lta na yang de dag rnams kyi nus pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mthu nyid kyis yin par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Even if that were so, their ability should be understood to be due to the Buddha's power alone.

original: des ni mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: des ni mi 'gal lo //
translated: Thus there is no contradiction.

original: don de yang 'di nyid du le'u dang por bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don de yang 'di nyid du le'u dang por bstan pa yin no //
translated: And this meaning is also taught in the first chapter of this very text.

original: de la dbang du bya ba ni gang gi ched du byas nas chos 'di ston par byed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i tshogs ni dbang du bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de la dbang du bya ba ni gang gi ched du byas nas chos 'di ston par byed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i tshogs ni dbang du bya ba yin te /
translated: There, the object is that for the sake of which this Dharma is taught. The assembly of bodhisattvas and so on is the object.

original: bstan pa 'di la dbang du bya bas zhes bye brag tu bshad pa 'dis so //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di la dbang du bya bas zhes bye brag tu bshad pa 'dis so //
translated: By this explanation, the object of this teaching is specified.

original: las ni bya ba dang byed pa dang spyod pa la brjod de /
analyzed: las ni bya ba dang byed pa dang spyod pa la brjod de /
translated: Action is said to be activity, doing, and performance.

original: byas pa nas zhes bya ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa 'dis so //
analyzed: byas pa nas zhes bya ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa 'dis so //
translated: This is the commentary on the third chapter, having three verses, called “the examination of action.

original: de ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'di ltar spyad par bya zhing 'di ltar gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'di ltar spyad par bya zhing 'di ltar gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ” Thus, the bodhisattva should practice the perfection of wisdom in this way, and should stand in this way, etc.

original: bsgom pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba rnam pa bcu bsal bas rtog par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba rnam pa bcu bsal bas rtog par bya'o //
translated: Cultivation is to be understood through the removal of the ten kinds of distraction of conceptualization.

original: stong pa nyid rnam pa bcu drug tu dbye bar nges par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnam pa bcu drug tu dbye bar nges par bya'o //
translated: Emptiness is to be ascertained as divided into sixteen aspects.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rtags ni tshad ma ste /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rtags ni tshad ma ste /
translated: The signs that will be mentioned are the means of valid cognition.

original: 'dis rtogs par byed pas na rtags so //
analyzed: 'dis rtogs par byed pas na rtags so //
translated: They are signs because they make one understand.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dri ba dang klog pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dri ba dang klog pa la /
translated: Thus, when the bodhisattva asks about and reads the perfection of wisdom,

original: ljongs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba gang yin pa de dag kyang bdud kyi las kyi rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: ljongs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba gang yin pa de dag kyang bdud kyi las kyi rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: whatever conceptualizations of country, etc. arise, they are the signs of the activity of Mara.

original: yang na byang @296b chub sems dpa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: yang na byang @296b chub sems dpa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags yin no //
translated: Or else, it is a sign of the bodhisattva's irreversibility.

original: nyes dmigs ni don med thog tu bab pa ste /
analyzed: nyes dmigs ni don med thog tu bab pa ste /
translated: The disadvantage is the descent of misfortune,

original: dam pa'i chos spong ba la sogs pas chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dug dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos spong ba la sogs pas chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dug dang bcas pa'o //
translated: because of the karma of despising the holy Dharma, etc., which leads to the loss of the Dharma, and because the perfection of wisdom is poisoned.

original: phan yon bcas zhes bya ba la phan yon ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: phan yon bcas zhes bya ba la phan yon ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: Along with its benefits means that the benefit is the result.

original: de ltar yang gzhung ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang gzhung ni 'di yin te /
translated: And the text is as follows:

original: gang zhig stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis bkang bar byas nas sbyin pa byin pa dang / gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis bkang bar byas nas sbyin pa byin pa dang / gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: One who gives a gift by filling the trichiliocosm with the seven jewels, and one who recites the perfection of wisdom and so on.

original: yang ci'i don du rten la sogs pa brjod ce na /🔽brjod pa ni dang ldan zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang ci'i don du rten la sogs pa brjod ce na / brjod pa ni dang ldan zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Again, for what purpose are the basis, etc. mentioned?🔽The statement is faith, etc.

original: dad ces bya ba ni dad pa ste sems rab tu dang ba'o //
analyzed: dad ces bya ba ni dad pa ste sems rab tu dang ba'o //
translated: Faith is confidence, a clear mind.

original: de yang zab mo'i tshul la lhag par mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: de yang zab mo'i tshul la lhag par mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is for the bodhisattvas who have a special inclination toward the profound way.

original: dad pa de gang dag la yod pa de dag ni dad ldan no //
analyzed: dad pa de gang dag la yod pa de dag ni dad ldan no //
translated: Those who have that faith are the faithful.

original: dad ldan de dag gi 'jug pa'i yan lag ces bya ba la 'jug pa dang 'brel ba'i yan lag ni 'jug pa'i yan lag go //

analyzed: tshig 'di las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis yang bkag go zhes bya bar yang gsal bar mdzad pa'o //

original: brjod pa'i phyi'i skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: brjod pa'i phyi'i skye mched rnams so //

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /🔽bza' bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na / bza' bar bya ba ste /

original: spyad par bya ba yin pas bza' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyad par bya ba yin pas bza' bar bya ba'o //
translated: because they are to be enjoyed.

original: gang gi phyir byis pa rnams kyis phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa log pa nyid la nye bar longs spyod par bya ba nyid du brtags pa des na bkag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byis pa rnams kyis phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa log pa nyid la nye bar longs spyod par bya ba nyid du brtags pa des na bkag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don yin no //

analyzed: sgra 'dis kyang phyi stong pa nyid brjod pa yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gzhan dag kyang brgyad @298b stong pa na yod pa yin no zhes stong pas brjod pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of emptiness is stated in the Astasahasrikā as follows:

original: gzugs sogs med na de yi ni //
analyzed: gzugs sogs med na de yi ni //
translated: When form, etc. do not exist,

original: lus gnas mtshan nyid zad pa'i don //
analyzed: lus gnas mtshan nyid zad pa'i don //
translated: the body is the characteristic of the exhaustion of the body.

original: rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: This is the realization.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽de yi lus zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / de yi lus zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How is that?🔽The body of that

original: phyi dang nang gi skye mched dag gi lus ni de'i lus so //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi skye mched dag gi lus ni de'i lus so //
translated: The body of that is the body of the internal and external sense-fields.

analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba la gnas ni snod kyi 'jig rten te 'dir gnas pas na gnas so //
translated: The term “place” refers to the world receptacle, since it is the place where beings dwell.

analyzed: mtshan nyid ces bya ba la mtshan nyid ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: The term “mark” refers to the thirty-two marks of a great person.

original: de rnams zad pa ni bral ba ste stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams zad pa ni bral ba ste stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Their “extinction” is their non-existence, which is the meaning of “emptiness.”

original: don de rtogs nyid ces bya ba la 'di'i don rtogs pa yin pas na don rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: don de rtogs nyid ces bya ba la 'di'i don rtogs pa yin pas na don rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of “realization” is that one realizes the meaning of emptiness.

original: gang rtogs she na /
analyzed: gang rtogs she na /
translated: What is realized?

original: des na brjod pa ni /
analyzed: des na brjod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gzugs sogs med na de yi ni //
analyzed: gzugs sogs med na de yi ni //
translated: “If form, etc., does not exist, then its emptiness does not exist.”

original: zhe brjod de /
analyzed: zhe brjod de /
translated: This is what is said.

original: gang gi tshe phyi dang nang gi skye mched rnams dngos po med par bstan pa de kho na'i tshe 'di rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyi don rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyi dang nang gi skye mched rnams dngos po med par bstan pa de kho na'i tshe 'di rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyi don rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
translated: The meaning of this statement is that when the external and internal bases are shown to be unreal, then at that time one realizes the meaning of their emptiness.🔽This treatise also expresses the three aspects of emptiness.

original: gzhung 'dis kyang stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gsum po rnams brjod pa yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhung 'dis kyang stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gsum po rnams brjod pa yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: What are the three?

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang / mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang / mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of the emptiness of external and internal, the aspect of the emptiness of the great, and the aspect of the emptiness of characteristics.🔽The aspect of the emptiness of emptiness is stated in order to show that:🔽That which sees that is not internal,🔽because it is empty.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa yang bstan pa'i don du brjod pa ni gang gis de mthong ba /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa yang bstan pa'i don du brjod pa ni gang gis de mthong ba /
translated: That which sees that is not external,🔽because it is empty.

analyzed: de yang nang pa yin phyir med // gang gis zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyis zhes pas so //
translated: That which sees that is not internal, because it is empty.🔽That which sees that is not external, because it is empty.🔽That which sees that is not both internal and external, because it is empty.🔽That which sees that is not a thing, because it is empty.🔽That which sees that is not a non-thing, because it is empty.🔽That which sees that is not existent, because it is empty.

original: de zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa de'i mthong ba zhes pa ni rtogs pa ste shes pa'o //🔽de yang nang pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa de nang gi skye mched yin te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa de'i mthong ba zhes pa ni rtogs pa ste shes pa'o // de yang nang pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa de nang gi skye mched yin te /
translated: That which sees that is not non-existent, because it is empty.

original: des na nang pa yin pa'i phyir na med de /
analyzed: des na nang pa yin pa'i phyir na med de /
translated: Therefore, this is the statement of the aspect of the emptiness of emptiness.🔽The aspect of the emptiness of nature is stated in order to show that:

original: yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That which sees that is not a nature,

original: de ni snga ma kho na bkag pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de ni snga ma kho na bkag pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: because it is empty.🔽That which sees that is not a non-nature, because it is empty.🔽That which sees that is not existent as a nature, because it is empty.🔽That which sees that is not non-existent as a nature, because it is empty.🔽That which sees that is not existent as a non-nature, because it is empty.🔽That which sees that is not non-existent as a non-nature, because it is empty.

original: des na 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the statement of the aspect of the emptiness of nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa yang gang gi phyir nang rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa yang gang gi phyir nang rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the aspect of emptiness of intrinsic nature is taught by “because the internal sense spheres are empty of the internal sense spheres,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir na nang gi skye mched rnams sngar brjod pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir na nang gi skye mched rnams sngar brjod pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir na /
translated: Because the internal sense spheres are empty in the manner previously explained,

original: rang bzhin yang ni stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang ni stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: therefore, the intrinsic nature is also empty.

original: rang bzhin ni rigs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rigs so //
translated: Intrinsic nature means lineage.

original: 'di nyid ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed do //
translated: This is clarified by “because of this,” and so on.

original: 'di ltar gyi sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don la yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gyi sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don la yin no //
translated: The word “because” has the meaning of “since.”

original: gang gi phyir rig pa de ni @299a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rig pa de ni @299a * //
translated: Because of that,

original: rnam shes rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam shes rang bzhin te /
translated: it is the nature of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa dang brtse ba dang / shes rab kyi bdag nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa dang brtse ba dang / shes rab kyi bdag nyid yin pas so //
translated: It is the essence of consciousness, and it is the nature of love and wisdom.

original: brtse ba ni gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: brtse ba ni gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Love is the desire for others to be free from suffering.

original: shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Wisdom has the characteristic of fully discerning phenomena.

original: brtse ba dang shes rab dag ni brtse ba dang shes rab bo //
analyzed: brtse ba dang shes rab dag ni brtse ba dang shes rab bo //
translated: Love and wisdom are love and wisdom.

original: de dag gi bdag nyid rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni brtse ba dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gi bdag nyid rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni brtse ba dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: He whose nature is that has the nature of love and wisdom.

original: rnam par shes pa ni nang gi skye mched yin pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni nang gi skye mched yin pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the internal sense base, he thinks.

original: 'dis kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: This also expresses the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du ;
analyzed: de bzhin du ;
translated: Likewise,

original: sems can skye med 'gag pa'ang med //
analyzed: sems can skye med 'gag pa'ang med //
translated: sentient beings are non-arisen and unceasing.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung rnams kyis ni brgyad stong par stong pa nyid des bstan par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung rnams kyis ni brgyad stong par stong pa nyid des bstan par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by these passages, the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines teaches that emptiness.

original: skye med ces bya ba ni skye ba 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: skye med ces bya ba ni skye ba 'gog pa ste /
translated: Non-arisen means the cessation of arising.

original: gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: He thinks that they are primordially non-arisen.

original: skye ba med pa nyid kyis na 'gag pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba med pa nyid kyis na 'gag pa med pa yin te /
translated: Because of their non-arising, they are unceasing.

analyzed: 'gag pa ni de sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: des na 'gag pa yang med do //
analyzed: des na 'gag pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, they are also unceasing.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: sems can zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi srog chags so //

analyzed: de nyid ni rdzas nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir sems can zhes brjod do //
translated: They are called “sentient beings” because they are accepted as real entities.

original: gang dag gis stong pa nyid bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gis stong pa nyid bstan zhe na /
translated: By whom was emptiness taught?

original: smras pa sems can dang 'khor ba dag gi'o //
analyzed: smras pa sems can dang 'khor ba dag gi'o //
translated: He says “of sentient beings and of cyclic existence.”

original: sems can zhes bya ba ni brjod ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba ni brjod ma thag pa'o //
translated: “ Sentient beings” are as just explained.

original: de nyid ni 'gro ba drug po rnams su 'di nas de dang de nas 'khor bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'gro ba drug po rnams su 'di nas de dang de nas 'khor bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are called “cyclic existence” because they cycle from this to that and back again in the six realms of existence.

original: yongs su 'khyams pa'i phyir na 'khor ba zhes brjod de /
analyzed: yongs su 'khyams pa'i phyir na 'khor ba zhes brjod de /
translated: They are called “cyclic existence” because they wander.

analyzed: 'khor bas na 'khor ba zhes bya ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa 'dis so //
translated: This is the explanation of the derivation of the term “cyclic existence.”

original: sems can dang 'khor ba zhes bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: sems can dang 'khor ba zhes bsdu ba'o //
translated: “ Sentient beings” and “cyclic existence” are synonyms.

original: byed pa po gang gis bstan ce na brjod pa des ni ste /
analyzed: byed pa po gang gis bstan ce na brjod pa des ni ste /

analyzed: de kho na rig pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa des so //
translated: “ That one” is the Tathāgata who knows reality.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

analyzed: gsal bar te gsal bar zhes bya ba ni bye brag phyed par ro //
translated: “Clearly” means clearly distinguished.

original: ci zhig bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig bstan zhe na /
translated: What is taught?

original: smras pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: smras pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is said: emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med cing bral ba ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med cing bral ba ste /
translated: Emptiness means non-existence and separation.

analyzed: ji ltar btags pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means the absence of what is imagined.

original: de yang ji ltar yang rung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar yang rung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: And that is not just anything,

analyzed: yang na gtsor zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs par te /

analyzed: de kho na nyid ni 'di nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the very reality. This is the meaning.

analyzed: brjod pa 'dis kyang stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gnyis bstan te /

analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: emptiness of what is beyond the extremes and emptiness of what is without beginning or end.

analyzed: thog ma ste dang po dang tha ma ste mtha'i cha yod pa ma yin pas na thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //

analyzed: de stong pa nyid ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that is the emptiness of no beginning or end.

analyzed: de skad du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' mi shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa yang 'dir bstan to zhes bstan pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /

analyzed: de rnams kyang de kho na'i ye shes dang ldan pas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blos mi dmigs pa ste /

analyzed: ma brtags pa de ni mi 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not refuted without analysis.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams ni //

analyzed: de yang sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: They are the special perfections such as generosity.

analyzed: de rnams kyang de kho na'i ye shes dang ldan pas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to zhes bya ba la sogs kyis /
translated: And they are not seen as real by those who possess the wisdom of thatness.

original: stobs bcu la sogs stong par bstan //
analyzed: stobs bcu la sogs stong par bstan //
translated: The ten powers and so forth are taught to be empty.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de skad ces bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis bstan to //
translated: This is taught by the passage beginning with the words “Thus. . . ”

original: gang zhig bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig bstan zhe na /
translated: What is taught?

original: stobs bcu la sogs so //
analyzed: stobs bcu la sogs so //

analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ma 'dres pa la sogs pa yang yongs su gzung ngo //

original: de dag ji ltar bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar bstan zhe na /
translated: How are they taught?

original: stong par te /
analyzed: stong par te /
translated: They are taught to be empty.

original: rang gi ngo bos dben pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos dben pa zhes brjod pa yin no //

analyzed: zhes bya ba gtan tshigs gang gi phyir so so so la brtags pa yin te / lhag par zhen par byas @300a * //

analyzed: de dag gang la zhe na /

original: ngag gzhan dag la 'ang shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngag gzhan dag la 'ang shes par bya // zhes bya ba'o //

original: mkhas rnams kyis te rnam par shes pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: mkhas rnams kyis te rnam par shes pa rnams kyis so //
translated: By the wise, that is, by the consciousnesses.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: ngag gzhan dag la yang ste 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ngag gzhan dag la yang ste 'di lta ste /
translated: In other scriptures as well, that is, in such statements as

original: chos thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams su yang ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams su yang ngo //
translated: “All phenomena are like an illusion.”

original: der yang skur par rnam par rtog pa sel ba kho nar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: der yang skur par rnam par rtog pa sel ba kho nar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: There too, one should understand that the conception of negation is eliminated.

original: yang brjod ma thag pa 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang brjod ma thag pa 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: Again, how is this just stated understood?

original: brjod pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: brjod pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: It is said:

original: gzhi mthun pa yis rgyal ba ni //🔽sgyu ma lta bur rab brjod cing //
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa yis rgyal ba ni // sgyu ma lta bur rab brjod cing //
translated: Because of the common locus,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the Victor is said to be like an illusion.

original: gal te yang thams cad du gnyis med kyi ye shes med pa nyid yin na de'i tshe gzhi mthun pa yis bstan pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gal te yang thams cad du gnyis med kyi ye shes med pa nyid yin na de'i tshe gzhi mthun pa yis bstan pa mi 'thad do //
translated: If nondual wisdom did not exist in all respects, then it would not be tenable to teach it by means of a common locus.

original: gtan tshigs ci ste zhe na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ci ste zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa rnams ni @308b mtha' gcig tu med pa'i phyir dang sangs rgyas ni yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because illusions and so on are utterly nonexistent and buddhas exist.🔽Moreover:

original: gzhan yang / sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i //
translated: Terms such as “like an illusion”

original: sgra rnams kyis kyang gzhan dbang brjod //
analyzed: sgra rnams kyis kyang gzhan dbang brjod //
translated: express the dependent nature.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rmi lam la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rmi lam la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The term “and so on” includes dreams and so on.

original: kyang gi sgras ni gtan tshigs kyi don te /
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni gtan tshigs kyi don te /
translated: The term “also” has the meaning of a reason.

analyzed: gang gi phyir sgyu ma la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis gzhan dbang brjod cing gsungs la /
translated: Because terms such as “like an illusion” express and teach the dependent nature.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: The Lord has taught it.

original: gzhan dbang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang du byas te ma rig pas bdag tu byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dbang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang du byas te ma rig pas bdag tu byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “dependent” is that it is made into a self by ignorance.

original: gnas skabs 'di la brten nas kyang sangs rgyas sgyu ma lta bu zhes brjod pa yin gyi rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba thams cad du thams cad med pa ma yin te /

translated: In this context, the Buddha is said to be like an illusion, but it is not the case that the natural purity of all things does not exist.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, all of the statements about the Buddha being like an illusion are tenable.

original: 'dis kyang sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can ma yin zhing gnyis med pa'i ye shes thams cad la med do zhes skur pa 'debs pa gang yin pa skur pa'i rnam par rtog pa de go skabs med par byas pa yin no zhes bya
analyzed: 'dis kyang sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can ma yin zhing gnyis med pa'i ye shes thams cad la med do zhes skur pa 'debs pa gang yin pa skur pa'i rnam par rtog pa de go skabs med par byas pa yin no zhes bya
translated: This also eliminates the possibility of the misconception that denies the existence of the Buddha nature in all sentient beings and the existence of nondual knowledge in all beings.

original: ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: This is the condensed meaning.

original: gal te don dam par gnyis su med pa'i shes pa de bzhin gshegs pa yin na de ji ltar so so skye bo'i shes pa la yang de'i sgras brjod ces dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni so so skye bo'i shes pa gang zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: gal te don dam par gnyis su med pa'i shes pa de bzhin gshegs pa yin na de ji ltar so so skye bo'i shes pa la yang de'i sgras brjod ces dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni so so skye bo'i shes pa gang zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: The response to this qualm is stated in the line “The consciousness of ordinary beings…”

original: pa ste / so so skye bo'i shes pa gang zhig rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa de la sangs rgyas kyi sgra brjod de bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pa ste / so so skye bo'i shes pa gang zhig rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa de la sangs rgyas kyi sgra brjod de bstan pa yin no //
translated: The term “buddha” is used to refer to the consciousness of ordinary beings that is pure by nature, the essence of natural complete purification.

original: de lta bur gyur pa gnyis med pa'i shes pa de la spyir de ltar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa gnyis med pa'i shes pa de la spyir de ltar brjod pa yin no //
translated: That nondual consciousness is generally referred to in that way.

original: yang na nye bar brtags nas de ltar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na nye bar brtags nas de ltar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Or it is referred to in that way after being imputed.

original: ji lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas bzhin ji ltar gnyis med pa'i shes pa yod pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' nyid la sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas bzhin ji ltar gnyis med pa'i shes pa yod pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' nyid la sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that just as the Buddha is said to be a buddha because he has nondual consciousness, so too the bodhisattva is said to be a buddha because he has nondual consciousness.

original: yang na rgyu yin pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa yin no //🔽gal te sangs rgyas rnams bzhin du so so skye bo rnams la yang de lta bur gyur pa'i shes pa srid pa yin na ci ste @309a * //
analyzed: yang na rgyu yin pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa yin no // gal te sangs rgyas rnams bzhin du so so skye bo rnams la yang de lta bur gyur pa'i shes pa srid pa yin na ci ste @309a * //
translated: Or else, because it is the cause, the Buddha is called “bodhisattva.”

original: mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: mi dmigs she na /
translated: If it is possible for the consciousness of ordinary people to be like that of the Buddhas, why is it not perceived?🔽It is said:

original: brjod pa ni ma rig pas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni ma rig pas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Because of nescience, etc.”

original: so so skye bo dang 'brel ba'i rnam par shes pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis gnyis med pa yin yang ma rig pas dbang du byas te bdag nyid kyir byas pas ni de'i rang gi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: so so skye bo dang 'brel ba'i rnam par shes pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis gnyis med pa yin yang ma rig pas dbang du byas te bdag nyid kyir byas pas ni de'i rang gi rang bzhin te /
translated: The consciousness associated with ordinary people, although nondual by nature, is dominated by nescience and is made into a self, and so its own nature is obscured.

original: bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin rab tu bsgribs nas gnyis med pa'i rang bzhin yin bzhin du yang gzhan du snang ste gnyis kyi rang bzhin du snang ngo //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin rab tu bsgribs nas gnyis med pa'i rang bzhin yin bzhin du yang gzhan du snang ste gnyis kyi rang bzhin du snang ngo //
translated: Although it has a nondual nature, it appears as something else, as having a dual nature.

original: ji lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: sgyu ma lta bur te /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur te /
translated: Like an illusion.

original: dper na sgyu ma rang bzhin med pa yin yang dngos po lta bur snang ba de bzhin du shes pa yang de yin no //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma rang bzhin med pa yin yang dngos po lta bur snang ba de bzhin du shes pa yang de yin no //
translated: For example, an illusion is devoid of intrinsic reality, but it appears as if it were a thing. Consciousness is like that.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad ces gal te yang byis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin 'di rang bzhin gyis gnyis med pa'i rtogs pa yin par brjod pa de lta na yang gzung ba dang 'dzin par phyin ci log gis rab tu bsgribs pa'i phyir byis pa la
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad ces gal te yang byis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin 'di rang bzhin gyis gnyis med pa'i rtogs pa yin par brjod pa de lta na yang gzung ba dang 'dzin par phyin ci log gis rab tu bsgribs pa'i phyir byis pa la
translated: This is what is being said: Even though the nature of the consciousness of ordinary beings and so on is described as the realization of the nonduality of intrinsic reality, still, because of being obscured by the error of subject and object, the consciousnesses of ordinary beings and so on do not know it.

original: sogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyis mi shes kyi 'on kyang thams cad kyi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mkhyen pa yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyis mi shes kyi 'on kyang thams cad kyi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mkhyen pa yin te /
translated: However, at all times it is known by the tathāgatas,

original: dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are stainless.

original: gal te de lta yin na ni 'o na thams cad kyi tshe ma rig pas bcings pa'i phyir na de la dri ma med pa gtan mi srid par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na ni 'o na thams cad kyi tshe ma rig pas bcings pa'i phyir na de la dri ma med pa gtan mi srid par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na /
translated: If that is so, then because they are bound by ignorance at all times, it would be utterly impossible for them to be stainless.

original: brjod pa ni /
analyzed: brjod pa ni /
translated: To respond:

original: 'bras bu rmi lam bzhin du spong //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rmi lam bzhin du spong //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The result is abandoned, like a dream.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba'i shes pa gang gi yin pa 'di ni gal te yang ma rig pas bdag tu byas pa yin pa de lta na yang thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis shes rab lhan cig phyed pa rnyed nas mi
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba'i shes pa gang gi yin pa 'di ni gal te yang ma rig pas bdag tu byas pa yin pa de lta na yang thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis shes rab lhan cig phyed pa rnyed nas mi
translated: This consciousness that is pure by nature, even though it is made into a self by ignorance, when it obtains wisdom through the characteristics of hearing, contemplation, etc.,

original: bden pa'i don ston par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu spong bar byed do //
analyzed: bden pa'i don ston par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu spong bar byed do //
translated: it abandons the result that has the characteristic of revealing the meaning of the unreal.

original: dper na rmi lam ni 'bras bu mi bden pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i rang bzhin can sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi rkyen dang phrad nas spong bar byed pa de bzhin du 'di'i yang yin no //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam ni 'bras bu mi bden pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i rang bzhin can sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi rkyen dang phrad nas spong bar byed pa de bzhin du 'di'i yang yin no //
translated: For example, just as a dream, which has the nature of revealing the meaning of the unreal result, is abandoned when it encounters the condition of the waking state, so it is in this case.🔽And because this is reasonable,

original: gang gi phyir 'di rigs pa yin pa de'i phyir na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di rigs pa yin pa de'i phyir na /
translated: therefore it is said:

original: gnyis med gzhan du snang ba can //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis med gzhan du snang ba can // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The nondual appears as other.”

original: gnyis med pa'i shes pa gzhan du snang ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis med pa'i shes pa gzhan du snang ba ste /
translated: The nondual consciousness appears as other.

original: @309b phyin ci log gi rang bzhin gnyis su gsal bar gyur pa na 'bras bu la yang ste /
analyzed: @309b phyin ci log gi rang bzhin gnyis su gsal bar gyur pa na 'bras bu la yang ste /
translated: When the two natures, the correct and the incorrect, are clearly distinguished, then with regard to the effect,
