analyzed: 'bras bu'i yul la ste de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu la rgol ba gang dag skur pa 'debs shing 'gog par byed pa gang dag yin pa'i rgol ba skur pa 'debs par byed pa rnams kyi skur pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang dag yin
translated: with regard to the object of the effect, the effect that has the characteristic of reality, those who argue, who deny, who refute, those who argue, who deny,

original: pa skur ba'i rnam par rtog par byed pa de dag la skur pa byed pa stong pa nyid kyis ni stong pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i mjug bsdu ba'i tshul gyis brjod do //
analyzed: pa skur ba'i rnam par rtog par byed pa de dag la skur pa byed pa stong pa nyid kyis ni stong pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i mjug bsdu ba'i tshul gyis brjod do //
translated: those conceptual thoughts that deny, those conceptual thoughts that deny, are denied by emptiness. This is expressed in the manner of a conclusion.

original: gzugs nyid stong pa nyid ma yin no zhes gcig pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa rab tu spyod pa gang yin pa gcig pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa 'di la gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba
analyzed: gzugs nyid stong pa nyid ma yin no zhes gcig pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa rab tu spyod pa gang yin pa gcig pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa 'di la gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba
translated: Form is not emptiness. This is the conceptual thought of identity. In this conceptual thought of identity, the emptiness of form is not form.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yum gyi ngag 'di der sbyar bas gcig pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa 'gog pa'i ngag bstan par byed pas brjod pa ni phan tshun du ni 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yum gyi ngag 'di der sbyar bas gcig pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa 'gog pa'i ngag bstan par byed pas brjod pa ni phan tshun du ni 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since this statement of the Mother, the perfection of wisdom, is applied there, the statement that refutes the conception of identity is made. The expression “because of mutual contradiction” and so on.

original: gzugs ni stong pa nyid yin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzugs ni stong pa nyid yin par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not tenable that form is emptiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phan tshun du ni 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: phan tshun du ni 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because of mutual contradiction.

original: stong pa nyid dang gzugs dang phan tshun gnod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang gzugs dang phan tshun gnod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because emptiness and form are mutually harmful.

original: ji ltar 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gal zhe na /
translated: How are they contradictory?

original: gang gi phyir stong pa nyid rang bzhin med pa nyid la ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir stong pa nyid rang bzhin med pa nyid la ste /
translated: Because emptiness is essencelessness.

original: nam mkha'i pad mo ltar ngo bo med pa yin zhing ngo //
analyzed: nam mkha'i pad mo ltar ngo bo med pa yin zhing ngo //
translated: It is like a sky flower, having no nature.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The term “nature” has the meaning of “definite.”

original: ngo bo med pa kho na yin zhing zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo bo med pa kho na yin zhing zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It has the meaning of “only having no nature.”

original: gzugs ni rnam pa dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs ni dkar po dang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs ni rnam pa dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs ni dkar po dang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Form is related to aspects means that form is endowed with aspects such as white and blue.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa dang yod pa dag la 'gal ba yin pa des na gcig tu rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa dang yod pa dag la 'gal ba yin pa des na gcig tu rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Since the absence and presence of intrinsic reality are contradictory, there is the distraction of conceptualizing them as one.

original: des na'i sgra ni gtan tshigs kyi don te /
analyzed: des na'i sgra ni gtan tshigs kyi don te /
translated: The word “since” has the meaning of a reason.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir gcig tu rnam par rtog pa la gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir gcig tu rnam par rtog pa la gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: Since that is so, there is the distraction of conceptualizing them as one, which is refuted by the statement:

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'dis gsal bar brjod do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'dis gsal bar brjod do //
translated: The emptiness of form is not form.

original: des na 'dis ni gcig nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba dgag pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dis ni gcig nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba dgag pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this passage explains the refutation of the distraction of conceptualizing them as one.🔽In order to refute the distraction of conceptualizing them as different, the root text says:

original: gzugs de ni stong pa nyid las gzhan yin no zhes tha dad pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de dgag pa'i don du /🔽shes @310a * //
analyzed: gzugs de ni stong pa nyid las gzhan yin no zhes tha dad pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de dgag pa'i don du /🔽shes @310a * //
translated: Form is not other than emptiness.

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yum de nyid las gzugs las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di gsungs pa ni ci zhig mdzad ce na 'gog pa yin te sel ba yin na //
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yum de nyid las gzugs las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di gsungs pa ni ci zhig mdzad ce na 'gog pa yin te sel ba yin na //
translated: What is the purpose of the statement in the Mother Perfection of Wisdom, “Form is not other than emptiness,” and so on? It is to refute, to eliminate.

original: ci zhig sel zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig sel zhe na /
translated: What is eliminated?

original: tha dad kyi ni rnam pa rtogs so //
analyzed: tha dad kyi ni rnam pa rtogs so //
translated: The conception of difference.

original: gang na na tshig rnam pa ji lta bur gang gi phyir na /
analyzed: gang na na tshig rnam pa ji lta bur gang gi phyir na /
translated: Where? In the words. In what way? For what purpose?

original: gang gi phyir gzugs de stong pa nyid las de phung po'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs ni stong pa nyid de la ltos nas ji lta bur yang gzhan min pas te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs de stong pa nyid las de phung po'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs ni stong pa nyid de la ltos nas ji lta bur yang gzhan min pas te /
translated: For what purpose? Form is not different from emptiness in any way, because form, which is characterized by being a skandha, is empty.

original: 'on kyang stong pa nyid kho na gzugs yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang stong pa nyid kho na gzugs yin te /
translated: However, emptiness itself is form.

original: stong pa nyid las tha dad pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las tha dad pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: There is nothing at all that is different from emptiness.

original: rnam pa ji lta bur yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa ji lta bur yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no difference in any way. This is the meaning.

original: des na 'dis ni tha dad pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'i rna na ci'i phyir stong pa nyid la tha dad pa'i gzug med ce na /
analyzed: des na 'dis ni tha dad pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'i rna na ci'i phyir stong pa nyid la tha dad pa'i gzug med ce na /
translated: Therefore, this is the reply to the question, “Why is emptiness not a different form from that?”

original: brjod pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽gang gi phyir ma rig pa sprul zhing rnam par bsgrubs pa rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de ni de'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yin yang de ni med pa kho na snang zhes bya ba med cing yod pa ma yin pa brdzun pa kho na snang zhing dngos
analyzed: brjod pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // gang gi phyir ma rig pa sprul zhing rnam par bsgrubs pa rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de ni de'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yin yang de ni med pa kho na snang zhes bya ba med cing yod pa ma yin pa brdzun pa kho na snang zhing dngos
translated: The reply is “Because, etc.”

original: po la mngon par zhen pa rnams bsal ba yin pa de'i phyir na stong pa nyid kyi tha dad nas gzugs gzhan ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: po la mngon par zhen pa rnams bsal ba yin pa de'i phyir na stong pa nyid kyi tha dad nas gzugs gzhan ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Because that form which is produced and established by ignorance, which is imagined, is devoid of its own nature, it is non-existent, it is only an appearance, it is only false, it is only a misapprehension of things. Therefore, emptiness is not a different form from that.

original: 'o na so so'i skye bo rnams kyi shes pa rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba gang yin pa de la ma rig pa'i sgrar brjod ces dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na so so'i skye bo rnams kyi shes pa rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba gang yin pa de la ma rig pa'i sgrar brjod ces dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni /
translated: Now, if the question is raised, “Why is the naturally pure consciousness of ordinary beings called ignorance?” the reply is as follows.

original: med pa ston par nus pas na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: med pa ston par nus pas na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is able to reveal nonexistence.

original: med pa'i ston par te yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don shes par byed pa der nus pa ste /
analyzed: med pa'i ston par te yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don shes par byed pa der nus pa ste /
translated: It is able to reveal nonexistence, to make known the meaning that is not real.

original: mthu yod pa'i nus pa de ni ma rig pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: mthu yod pa'i nus pa de ni ma rig pa zhes brjod de /
translated: That ability, which has the power to do that, is called ignorance.

original: rab tu bsnyad kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab tu bsnyad kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: It is explained, but not ultimately.

original: rang bzhin de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rang bzhin de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: That very nature, etc.

original: lam bsgom pa'i stobs kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang nub pa'i phyir na ma rig pa dang bral zhing rang bzhin gyis rnam par bral ba'i rang bzhin 'di nyid ni shes rab kyis spangs pa rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes
analyzed: lam bsgom pa'i stobs kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang nub pa'i phyir na ma rig pa dang bral zhing rang bzhin gyis rnam par bral ba'i rang bzhin 'di nyid ni shes rab kyis spangs pa rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes
translated: Because of the cultivation of the path, the power of the object and subject of knowledge disappears, and this very nature, which is naturally free from ignorance, is the perfection of wisdom of those who abandon through wisdom.

original: brjod cing bstan to //
analyzed: brjod cing bstan to //
translated: It is said and taught.

original: 'o na ma rig pa'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa shes la rab tu rgyu ba 'di la gnod par byed pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ma rig pa'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa shes la rab tu rgyu ba 'di la gnod par byed pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the harm in this, that the nature of ignorance is the movement of the wisdom that knows?

original: brjod pa ni gnyis 'di nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: brjod pa ni gnyis 'di nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement is this very duality and so forth.

original: gnyis su snang ba gang @310b yin pa 'di nyid don dam pa'i rang bzhin du gnyis med pa'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba shes pa thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis lhan cig byed pa dang / 'brel ba ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa gnyis la gnod byed yin zhing gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: gnyis su snang ba gang @310b yin pa 'di nyid don dam pa'i rang bzhin du gnyis med pa'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba shes pa thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis lhan cig byed pa dang / 'brel ba ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa gnyis la gnod byed yin zhing gnyen po yin te /
translated: The very appearance of duality is purified by the nondual nature of the ultimate nature, by the wisdom of hearing, thinking, and meditating, which is the cooperating condition. The connection is that the two conceptual thoughts characterized by nonexistence are the object of negation and the antidote.

original: 'dir gnod par byed ces bya bas so //
analyzed: 'dir gnod par byed ces bya bas so //
translated: Here, the object of negation is the object of negation.

original: de'i phyir de kho na nyid ni de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na nyid ni de nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is the way things really are.

original: de kho nas gnod pa byed do zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni rtog pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de kho nas gnod pa byed do zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni rtog pa yang yin te /
translated: The meaning of it is negated by that is conceptual.

original: dper na smig rgyu'i tshogs la mi bden pa'i tshul shes pa la chu med pa'i dben pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na smig rgyu'i tshogs la mi bden pa'i tshul shes pa la chu med pa'i dben pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the cognition of the absence of water in a mirage, which is known to be unreal.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na mchog rig pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par g-yeng ba bcu po 'di dag gi gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yum du gsungs pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na mchog rig pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par g-yeng ba bcu po 'di dag gi gnyen por shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yum du gsungs pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata, who knows the supreme reality, taught the mother, the perfection of wisdom, as the antidote to these ten distractions.

original: phyin pa thams cad du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phyin pa thams cad du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Nonconceptual cognition is taught as the perfection of wisdom everywhere.

original: gal te de lta yin na 'o na ji ltar bsdus pa mdzad pas rnam par rtog pa gnyis la gnod pa byed pa ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na 'o na ji ltar bsdus pa mdzad pas rnam par rtog pa gnyis la gnod pa byed pa ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it that the Compendium states that it counters the two types of conceptuality?

original: nyes pa med de /
analyzed: nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa gnyis po kho nar rnam par rtog pa gzhan dag kyang 'dus pa'i phyir na de bsal na thams cad kyang don gyis bsal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa mdzad pa'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa gnyis po kho nar rnam par rtog pa gzhan dag kyang 'dus pa'i phyir na de bsal na thams cad kyang don gyis bsal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa mdzad pa'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: Because the two types of conceptuality include all other types of conceptuality, when they are eliminated, all are eliminated by implication. This is the intention of the author of the Compendium.

original: gal te gnyis po 'di dag tu rnam par g-yeng ba gzhan rnams kyang nang du 'du ba yin na bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par g-yeng ba mang po rnams ston par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: gal te gnyis po 'di dag tu rnam par g-yeng ba gzhan rnams kyang nang du 'du ba yin na bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par g-yeng ba mang po rnams ston par mdzad ce na /
translated: If the other distractions are included in these two, why did the Lord teach many kinds of distraction?

original: bstan par bya ba'i bsam pa'i dbang gis g-yeng ba pa yin te /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba'i bsam pa'i dbang gis g-yeng ba pa yin te /
translated: They are taught according to the intention of the one to be taught.

original: shin tu spros pas chog go //🔽ji ltar shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'gal zla yin pa de ltar rigs par yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes brjod pa'i rigs pa yang gsungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu spros pas chog go // ji ltar shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'gal zla yin pa de ltar rigs par yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes brjod pa'i rigs pa yang gsungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Enough of this extensive discussion.🔽Just as the Lord has taught that conceptualization is the opposite of knowledge, so also has he taught that reasoning is the opposite of distraction.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i shes pa rnam par g-yeng ba rnams kyi gnyen po ji ltar yin pa de ltar ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs pa yang gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i shes pa rnam par g-yeng ba rnams kyi gnyen po ji ltar yin pa de ltar ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs pa yang gsungs te /
translated: Just as non-conceptual knowledge is the antidote to the distractions, so also has the Lord taught that reasoning is the antidote to distraction.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'thad pa yang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'thad pa yang brjod pa yin no //
translated: He has also stated this in the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: rnam dag phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par dag cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin pa de'i phyir ma dag pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba rnams kyis gnod byed yin no //
analyzed: rnam dag phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par dag cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin pa de'i phyir ma dag pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba rnams kyis gnod byed yin no //
translated: “Because of purity” means that because it is pure and luminous by nature, it is harmed by the distractions of impurity.

original: de bzhin gyi sgra ni @311a * //🔽bsdu ba la ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gyi sgra ni @311a * // bsdu ba la ste /
translated: The word “also”

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir yang ngo //
translated: includes the non-apprehension of the object.

original: gang gi phyir gcig nyid la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di dag 'thad pa mi dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig nyid la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di dag 'thad pa mi dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Because the existence of singularity, etc. is not apprehended,

original: gnyis med pa'i shes pa ni tshad mas nges pa yin pa des na de ni gnod pa byed pa yin no zhes nges so //
analyzed: gnyis med pa'i shes pa ni tshad mas nges pa yin pa des na de ni gnod pa byed pa yin no zhes nges so //
translated: and because non-dual cognition is ascertained by valid cognition, it is ascertained that it is harmed.

original: yang tshad ma gang gis dmigs she na rjes su dpag pas so zhes smra'o //
analyzed: yang tshad ma gang gis dmigs she na rjes su dpag pas so zhes smra'o //
translated: By what valid cognition is it apprehended? It is said to be inferred.

original: gang gi rang rig pa yin pa de ni gzhan gyi khyad par can ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi rang rig pa yin pa de ni gzhan gyi khyad par can ma yin te /
translated: That which is self-aware is not qualified by another,

original: dper na bde ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bde ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like pleasure, etc.

original: rtsod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i shes pa yang rang rig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i shes pa yang rang rig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The cognition that is the locus of dispute is also reflexive awareness. This is the observation of a contradictory nature.

original: gzhan gyi khyad par can nyid yin na rang rig pa mi 'thad pa ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi khyad par can nyid yin na rang rig pa mi 'thad pa ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: If it were the qualifier of something other, reflexive awareness would be untenable. This is the valid cognition that refutes that.

original: 'dir sngon po la sogs pas ma nges pa nyid la sogs par dogs par bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sngon po la sogs pas ma nges pa nyid la sogs par dogs par bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is not even something to be doubted, such as that it is not ascertained by blue and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de dag kyang don dam par rang rig pas grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir na snang ba'i dbang gis ni phyir phyogs pa yin pa las gzhan gyi khyad par can du 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag kyang don dam par rang rig pas grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir na snang ba'i dbang gis ni phyir phyogs pa yin pa las gzhan gyi khyad par can du 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Because those are also established by reflexive awareness ultimately, they are posited from the perspective of appearance. It is a mistake to think that they are the qualifiers of something other.

original: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa de dag ni don dam par med pa'i phyir shes pa 'ba' zhig nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa de dag ni don dam par med pa'i phyir shes pa 'ba' zhig nyid de /
translated: In this way, because those such as blue and so on do not exist ultimately, they are only cognition.

original: de ltar rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rigs pa yin te /
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: des na kha na ma tho ba med do //
analyzed: des na kha na ma tho ba med do //
translated: Therefore there is no fault.

original: de bzhin du phyi rol gyi don gyi tshul la rang rig pa ji lta ba bzhin du don rnam par gnas pa yin gyi don ji lta ba nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi rol gyi don gyi tshul la rang rig pa ji lta ba bzhin du don rnam par gnas pa yin gyi don ji lta ba nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, in the system of external objects, the object is just as it is placed, not as it is, due to autocognition.

original: des na skyon med do //
analyzed: des na skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault.

original: dpe ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dpe ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the example unestablished.🔽The experience of pleasure and so on is the experience of pleasure and so on, but it is not the experience of the reality of pleasure and so on.

original: bde ba la sogs pa myong ba ni bde ba myong ba yin gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par yang dag par myong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas bde ba la sogs phyi rol pa med par ni gzhan du rnam par dpyad zin🔽pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa myong ba ni bde ba myong ba yin gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par yang dag par myong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas bde ba la sogs phyi rol pa med par ni gzhan du rnam par dpyad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus the nonexistence of external pleasure and so on has already been analyzed elsewhere.

original: des na de ltar 'di ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas dben pa'i shes pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar 'di ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas dben pa'i shes pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore consciousness is devoid of the aspects of object and apprehender, but nothing else exists.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med na 'o na gang zhig rnam par shes par gyur pa de la gzhan ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med na 'o na gang zhig rnam par shes par gyur pa de la gzhan ci zhig yod /
translated: If consciousness is devoid of object and apprehender, then what other thing exists in consciousness?

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang gnyis las rnam par grol ba'i rang bzhin gzhan ni de la tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis yang dag par rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang gnyis las rnam par grol ba'i rang bzhin gzhan ni de la tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis yang dag par rig pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of the mind, which is free from the duality of subject and object, is not known by those who see only this side.

original: yang dag par rig na de kho na mthong bar thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang dag par rig na de kho na mthong bar thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If it were known, it would follow that they would see reality.

original: de lta na yang lus can thams cad 'bad pa med par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang lus can thams cad 'bad pa med par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, all embodied beings would be liberated without effort.

original: gang gis rjes su dpog par byed pa 'di la 'bras bu yang yod pa ma @311b yin te /
analyzed: gang gis rjes su dpog par byed pa 'di la 'bras bu yang yod pa ma @311b yin te /
translated: And there is no result in this inference,

original: gnyis med pa'i rang bzhin de nyid 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de yang tshad mas ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis med pa'i rang bzhin de nyid 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de yang tshad mas ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that very nondual nature is the result, and that is not established by a valid cognition.

original: gnyis kyi rang bzhin du snang ba gang yin pa de yang ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bas 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rang bzhin du snang ba gang yin pa de yang ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bas 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: And whatever appears as having a dual nature is not the result, because it is like the horn of a rabbit.

original: nyes pa 'di ni med de /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni med de /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: gang gi de yang med par 'gyur ba de 'dzin pa'i sgras snang gi rtogs pa'i rang bzhin brjod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol du gyur pa'o zhes snang ba gang yin pa de ni gcig dang du mar dpyad mi bzod pa'i
analyzed: gang gi de yang med par 'gyur ba de 'dzin pa'i sgras snang gi rtogs pa'i rang bzhin brjod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol du gyur pa'o zhes snang ba gang yin pa de ni gcig dang du mar dpyad mi bzod pa'i
translated: The word “that” does not refer to the nature of the cognition that appears as the apprehender, but rather to the external object such as blue.

original: phyir de kho na nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: phyir de kho na nyid ma yin te /
translated: The appearance of that is not reality because it cannot withstand analysis as being either one or many.

original: des na rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i gzung bar bya ba don dam par med la /
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i gzung bar bya ba don dam par med la /
translated: Therefore, an object that is different from consciousness does not exist ultimately.

original: de med pa'i phyir na de la ltos nas gzung ba 'di 'dzin par byed pa ni 'di yin no zhes rtogs pa'i rang bzhin la byed pa po nyid du brtags pa gang yin pa de med pa yin no //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir na de la ltos nas gzung ba 'di 'dzin par byed pa ni 'di yin no zhes rtogs pa'i rang bzhin la byed pa po nyid du brtags pa gang yin pa de med pa yin no //
translated: Since that does not exist, the nature of the cognition that is the apprehender of that, which is imputed to be the agent, does not exist.

original: des na byed pa po dang las dag phan tshun ltos nas brtags pa yin pa'i phyir 'dzin par byed pa'i rang bzhin med par brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na byed pa po dang las dag phan tshun ltos nas brtags pa yin pa'i phyir 'dzin par byed pa'i rang bzhin med par brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, since the agent and action are imputed in mutual dependence, the nature of the apprehender is said to be nonexistent.

original: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin rang rig pa tsam ni 'dzin par byed pa'i sgras brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin rang rig pa tsam ni 'dzin par byed pa'i sgras brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of realization is mere self-awareness, which is not expressed by the word “apprehending.”

original: 'di ltar rtogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin ni phan tshun ltos nas rab tu brtags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin ni phan tshun ltos nas rab tu brtags pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the nature of realization is not imputed in dependence on each other,

original: rang gi rgyud las de ltar skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud las de ltar skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises in that way from one’s own continuum.

original: ji skad du brjod pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid dang bral ba'i phyir rang bzhin rang rig pa tsam rnam par gnas pa de nyid la de skad ces brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid dang bral ba'i phyir rang bzhin rang rig pa tsam rnam par gnas pa de nyid la de skad ces brjod pa yin te /
translated: Because it is free from the apprehended and apprehender as they are described, the mere self-awareness that is the nature of realization is said to be “present.”

original: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub po //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub po //
translated: The nature of realization is also established by the direct perception of self-awareness.

original: thams cad de kho na mthong bar yang mi thal te /
analyzed: thams cad de kho na mthong bar yang mi thal te /
translated: It is not the case that everything is seen as such,

original: gang gi phyir cha med pa'i phyir gnyis med pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir cha med pa'i phyir gnyis med pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: because the nature of realization is nondual, since it is partless.

original: gzung ba nyid la 'khrul pa'i sa bon rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gnyis med par snang ba mi skye ste /
analyzed: gzung ba nyid la 'khrul pa'i sa bon rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gnyis med par snang ba mi skye ste /
translated: The nature of realization that appears as nondual does not arise because the seed of error in regard to the apprehended is connected.

original: des na gnyis med pa'i rang bzhin ni gzung ba yin na yang ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gnyis med pa'i rang bzhin ni gzung ba yin na yang ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of non-duality is like not apprehending even though there is apprehension.

original: 'di tsam gyis spyir rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos can ma grub pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis spyir rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos can ma grub pa yang ma yin no //
translated: By this much, in general, the nature of the object of knowledge is not unestablished.

original: 'di ltar don thams cad la skur par byed pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dngos po khas len pas kyang gdon mi za bar med pa'i don gsal bar byed nus pa'i shes pa nyid la ma rig pa yin no zhes khas blangs dgos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar don thams cad la skur par byed pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dngos po khas len pas kyang gdon mi za bar med pa'i don gsal bar byed nus pa'i shes pa nyid la ma rig pa yin no zhes khas blangs dgos te /
translated: Thus, even those who accept the conventional and ultimate entities that deny all objects must certainly accept that the consciousness that is able to manifest the meaning of non-existence is ignorance,

original: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because another possibility is not possible.

original: de lta bu de la gnod pa byed pa yang phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam pa can rig pa'i rang bzhin yin @312a * //🔽par gdon mi za bar 'dod par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: de lta bu de la gnod pa byed pa yang phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam pa can rig pa'i rang bzhin yin @312a * // par gdon mi za bar 'dod par bya ba yin na /
translated: And that must certainly be accepted as having the nature of knowledge with an aspect that is non-erroneous.

original: gal te yang don dam pa'i tshul gyis rang bzhin med pa nyid yin na de'i tshe gnod pa byed par mi 'gyur te nam mkha'i pad mo bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te yang don dam pa'i tshul gyis rang bzhin med pa nyid yin na de'i tshe gnod pa byed par mi 'gyur te nam mkha'i pad mo bzhin no //
translated: But if it is natureless in the manner of the ultimate, then it will not be able to harm, like a sky-lotus.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig gnod par byed pa de ni yod pa'i tha snyad du rung ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig gnod par byed pa de ni yod pa'i tha snyad du rung ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, that which is the object of refutation is suitable as a conventional existent.

original: dper na grang ba la dro ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na grang ba la dro ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the entity that has the nature of heat in relation to cold.

original: yod pa'i don gsal ba gnyis med pa'i shes pa 'di yang med pa'i don gsal bar byed pa ma rig pa'i gnod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yod pa'i don gsal ba gnyis med pa'i shes pa 'di yang med pa'i don gsal bar byed pa ma rig pa'i gnod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This consciousness that is nondual and illuminates the meaning of existence is the object of refutation of ignorance that illuminates the meaning of nonexistence. This is a natural argument.

original: med bzhin du 'di la yang kun rdzob pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa yin no zhes ni brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: med bzhin du 'di la yang kun rdzob pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa yin no zhes ni brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be said that “although it does not exist, it exists as the nature of the concealer.”

original: gang gi phyir khyed kyis gnyis kyi rnam par 'jug pa'i shes pa la gnyis med pa'i shes pa yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyed kyis gnyis kyi rnam par 'jug pa'i shes pa la gnyis med pa'i shes pa yod pa yin la /
translated: Because you say that the consciousness that engages in the aspect of duality is the consciousness that is nondual,🔽and you say that ignorance is the concealer.

original: ma rig pa ni kun rdzob yin par brjod pa yin na de skad smra ba na /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni kun rdzob yin par brjod pa yin na de skad smra ba na /
translated: When you speak in this way,

original: ji ltar rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar mi 'gyur /
translated: how is it that you are not contradicting your own words?

original: des na rig pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan la ni kun rdzob par yod pa nyid dang gnyis med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rigs pa la ni don dam pa'i yod pa yin no zhes bya ba rigs pa'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa 'di ni mi 'dod kyang khas blang bar
analyzed: des na rig pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan la ni kun rdzob par yod pa nyid dang gnyis med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rigs pa la ni don dam pa'i yod pa yin no zhes bya ba rigs pa'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa 'di ni mi 'dod kyang khas blang bar
translated: Therefore, although one does not accept that the existence of the conventional is the existence of something other than the nature of knowledge, and that the existence of the ultimate is the existence of something characterized by nonduality, one must accept this

original: bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bya ba yin no //
translated: which is established by the power of reasoning.

original: rtsod pa 'di rgyas par ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas gzhan du rnam par dpyad pa des na 'dir mi spros pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di rgyas par ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas gzhan du rnam par dpyad pa des na 'dir mi spros pa'o //
translated: This debate is analyzed extensively elsewhere by the Acarya, so I will not elaborate on it here.

original: de bzhin du rigs pa tha dad pa gzhan yang gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs pa tha dad pa gzhan yang gsungs pa ni /
translated: In the same way, another different reasoning is stated:

original: dngos dang dngos med 'gal phyir yang //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med 'gal phyir yang // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because existence and nonexistence are contradictory.

original: yang gi sgra ni bsams pa la'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni bsams pa la'o //
translated: The word “also” is intended.

original: sngar brjod pa'i rigs pa 'ba' zhig las rtog pa dang bral ba'i rnam par shes pa rnam par g-yeng ba rnams kyi gnod byed yin par ni zad de dngos po dang dngos po med pa 'gal ba'i phyir yang de la gnod byed yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i rigs pa 'ba' zhig las rtog pa dang bral ba'i rnam par shes pa rnam par g-yeng ba rnams kyi gnod byed yin par ni zad de dngos po dang dngos po med pa 'gal ba'i phyir yang de la gnod byed yin par rtogs so //
translated: The only reason given above is that the consciousness free from conceptualization is harmed by the distractions of conceptualization. We understand that it is harmed because existence and nonexistence are contradictory.

original: 'di ltar sna tshogs pa la sogs pa'i don ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin la rtog pa'i dra ba dang bral ba'i shes pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar sna tshogs pa la sogs pa'i don ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin la rtog pa'i dra ba dang bral ba'i shes pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin ni //
translated: Thus, the meaning of “variety,” etc., is the nature of nonexistence, and consciousness free from the net of conceptualization is the nature of existence.

original: des na gang na bden pa'i don gsal bar nus pa'i shes pa de yod pa der don dam par med pa'i rang bzhin gcig nyid la sogs pa rnams yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: des na gang na bden pa'i don gsal bar nus pa'i shes pa de yod pa der don dam par med pa'i rang bzhin gcig nyid la sogs pa rnams yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, where there is a consciousness that is able to illuminate a real object, there is no existence of oneness, etc., which have the nature of ultimate nonexistence.

original: yang med pa'i tha dad nyid kyang mthong ba gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'i stobs kyis yin no zhes khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: yang med pa'i tha dad nyid kyang mthong ba gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'i stobs kyis yin no zhes khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: Moreover, the very difference of nonexistence is seen by the power of ignorance.

original: kyang gi sgra ni @312b gcig nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni @312b gcig nyid kyang ngo //
translated: The word “also” means “oneness also.”

original: 'dig las she na /
analyzed: 'dig las she na /
translated: How so?

original: gzugs 'di ming tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do //
analyzed: gzugs 'di ming tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do //
translated: “This form is a mere name,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir gzugs ni ming tsam yin par gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir gzugs ni ming tsam yin par gsungs te /
translated: Because the Lord has said in the Perfection of Wisdom that form is a mere name,

original: de'i phyir de nyid du ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid du ste /
translated: therefore, in that very place,

original: don dam par dngos po'i gnas lugs su ni phung po'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs ni rang gi ngo bor yod pa min pas te stong pa yin pas so //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po'i gnas lugs su ni phung po'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs ni rang gi ngo bor yod pa min pas te stong pa yin pas so //
translated: in the ultimate reality, the reality of things, form, which is characterized by the aggregates, does not exist in its own nature, because it is empty.

original: ming tsam zhes bya ba ni ming du btags pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: ming tsam zhes bya ba ni ming du btags pa tsam yin no //
translated: “Mere name” means it is a mere nominal designation.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na de la ngo bo nyid du ni rnam rtog rnams kyi zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na de la ngo bo nyid du ni rnam rtog rnams kyi zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because that is so, therefore, “in that regard, conceptualization in terms of intrinsic reality,” and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni yul de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni yul de la'o //
translated: “In that regard” means in regard to that object.

original: ngo bo nyid ni sra ba nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni sra ba nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Intrinsic reality” means solidity and so on.

original: yang na de dang 'brel ba'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: yang na de dang 'brel ba'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, it is conceptualization that is related to that.

original: lhag par sgro 'dogs pa ni de la ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag par sgro 'dogs pa ni de la ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: Exaggeration is conceptualization in terms of intrinsic reality.

original: de nas de la ngo bo nyid du ni rnam rtog rnams ni go skabs te 'jug pa'i gnas sel zhing 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas de la ngo bo nyid du ni rnam rtog rnams ni go skabs te 'jug pa'i gnas sel zhing 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Then, with regard to that, the reality of the conceptualizations is eliminated, i.e., is stopped, as a place for the occurrence of an occasion.

original: 'dis ni ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba bsal ba yin no //
translated: This eliminates the distraction of conceptualization as reality.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang de'i yul du zlos pa'i skyon sel bar brjod pa ni gzugs ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang de'i yul du zlos pa'i skyon sel bar brjod pa ni gzugs ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The elimination of the fault of the repetition of the perfection of wisdom and its object is stated in the passage beginning “form is empty of the intrinsic nature of form,” etc.

original: snga ma kho nar brjod cing bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma kho nar brjod cing bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is just what was previously stated and explained.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?🔽It is speech.

original: ngag go // ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ngag go // ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of speech?

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis stong par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis stong par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is the speech that is empty of the intrinsic nature of form, etc.

original: ngag 'di lta bu rang gi ngo bo yis //
analyzed: ngag 'di lta bu rang gi ngo bo yis //
translated: This kind of speech

original: sgro 'dogs rnam rtog 'gog byed yin //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs rnam rtog 'gog byed yin //
translated: stops the conceptualization that is superimposition.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bos stong pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi sgro 'dogs pa lhag par sbyor ba de'i rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i kun🔽tu rtog pa de'i 'gog par byed pa gnod par byed pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bos stong pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi sgro 'dogs pa lhag par sbyor ba de'i rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i kun tu rtog pa de'i 'gog par byed pa gnod par byed pa yin pa'o //
translated: This is the refutation, the refutation of the essential reality of the conception that engages in the superimposition of such a nature, i.e., the superimposition that form is not empty of the entity of form, which has the character of particular and universal form.

original: 'dis ni sngar gyi sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ni gzugs rang gi ngo bor yod pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bur rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sgro 'dogs pa bsal ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni sngar gyi sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ni gzugs rang gi ngo bor yod pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bur rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sgro 'dogs pa bsal ba yin la /
translated: This eliminates the distraction of the previous superimposition, i.e., the superimposition that form exists as the entity of form, in the form of the superimposition of particular and universal characters.

original: 'dir sra ba nyid la sogs pa mtshan nyid kyi yul yod do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i sgro 'dogs de sel ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sra ba nyid la sogs pa mtshan nyid kyi yul yod do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i sgro 'dogs de sel ba yin te /
translated: Here it eliminates the superimposition that the object of characteristics such as solidity exists.

original: de nas snga ma las khyad par yod do //
analyzed: de nas snga ma las khyad par yod do //
translated: Thus there is a difference from the previous.

original: 'di 'ba' zhig 'gog pa ni ma zad kyi rnam par g-yeng ba gzhan yang 'gog @313a * //
analyzed: 'di 'ba' zhig 'gog pa ni ma zad kyi rnam par g-yeng ba gzhan yang 'gog @313a * //
translated: Not only is this alone refuted, but also other distractions are refuted.

original: pa brjod pa ni chos rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa brjod pa ni chos rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement of that is “The Blessed One said that phenomena…” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir chos rnams kyi ni skye ba dang / 'gag pa mthong ba med ces de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos rnams kyi ni skye ba dang / 'gag pa mthong ba med ces de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Because the Blessed One said in the Perfection of Wisdom that the arising and ceasing of phenomena is not seen,

original: de ltar gsungs pa des ni /
analyzed: de ltar gsungs pa des ni /
translated: as it is said:

original: de'i phyir bsal ba yin te spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsal ba yin te spangs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is refuted, it is abandoned.

original: de'i khyad par rnam rtog ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa de'i khyad par gang yin pa skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid de yod pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin can ngo bo nyid kyis khyad par du rnam par rtog pa
analyzed: de'i khyad par rnam rtog ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa de'i khyad par gang yin pa skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid de yod pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin can ngo bo nyid kyis khyad par du rnam par rtog pa
translated: The distinction is conceptualized. The distinction of form and so on, which has the characteristic of arising and ceasing, exists. Such a nature is essentially conceptualized as a distinction.

original: bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: bsal ba yin no //
translated: It is refuted.

original: 'dis ni khyad par gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba bsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni khyad par gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba bsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: By this, the distraction of conceptualizing distinctions is refuted.

original: de bzhin du rnam par g-yeng ba gzhan yang 'gog pa'i rgyu mtshan ston pas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par g-yeng ba gzhan yang 'gog pa'i rgyu mtshan ston pas brjod pa ni /
translated: Likewise, the statement of the reason for stopping other distractions is

original: gang phyir ming bcos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang phyir ming bcos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “because of the fabrication of names, etc.”

original: ming bcos zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yum las gsungs pa'i gzhung dang sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ming bcos zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yum las gsungs pa'i gzhung dang sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The fabrication of names is to be applied to the text of the Mother of the Victorious Ones, the Perfection of Wisdom,

original: ming ni kun du brtags pa yin no zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: ming ni kun du brtags pa yin no zhes ston pa'o //
translated: which teaches that “names are imputations.”🔽Likewise, the statement “these phenomena are to be investigated” is to be applied to another text of the Mother of the Victorious Ones, the Perfection of Wisdom,

original: de bzhin du chos 'di rnams so sor brtags pa yin no zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yum gyi gzhung gzhan dang sbyor bar byed pa ni sgra'i brjod bya'i don gyi chos gang yin pa de dag kyang btags pa yin pas sgro btags🔽pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos 'di rnams so sor brtags pa yin no zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yum gyi gzhung gzhan dang sbyor bar byed pa ni sgra'i brjod bya'i don gyi chos gang yin pa de dag kyang btags pa yin pas sgro btags🔽pa yin te /
translated: which teaches that “the phenomena that are the referents of words are also fabrications, and thus are superimpositions.”

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir sgra don dag gi 'brel ba ni zhes bya ba dngos por gyur pa'i 'brel pa bcom ldan 'das des mi bzhed de 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir sgra don dag gi 'brel ba ni zhes bya ba dngos por gyur pa'i 'brel pa bcom ldan 'das des mi bzhed de 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because that is so, therefore the Lord does not accept, does not maintain, that the relation of word and meaning is a real entity, a relation.

original: 'on kyang rtog pa'i blos sbyor ba tsam mo //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtog pa'i blos sbyor ba tsam mo //
translated: However, it is merely a connection made by the conceptual mind.

original: byis pa'i phyi rol tu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang yang byis pa'i phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen pa'i 'khrul pas 'di ni phyi rol gyi don yin no zhes par spyad pa yin no //
analyzed: byis pa'i phyi rol tu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang yang byis pa'i phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen pa'i 'khrul pas 'di ni phyi rol gyi don yin no zhes par spyad pa yin no //
translated: As for the external of the childish, etc., whatever is practiced by the delusion of the childish, who are attached to external objects, is said to be an external object.

original: sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad 'di yang nges pa de'i sgo nas 'jug pa yin gyi sgra 'di la don ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad 'di yang nges pa de'i sgo nas 'jug pa yin gyi sgra 'di la don ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And this convention, which has the character of affirmation and negation, operates by way of that determination, but there is no meaning at all in this word.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i rgyu de bas na 'gro ba 'dir ji ltar ming byas pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i rgyu de bas na 'gro ba 'dir ji ltar ming byas pa ste /
translated: Because that is so, therefore, in this world, how is it that names are made?

original: ji ltar rjod byed byas shing sbyar ba de ltar brjod bya'i ngos po de yod min no //
analyzed: ji ltar rjod byed byas shing sbyar ba de ltar brjod bya'i ngos po de yod min no //
translated: As the expressing word is made and applied, so the object expressed does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir ming ji bzhin du don du rnam rtog 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir ming ji bzhin du don du rnam rtog 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it is so, therefore, the meaning is not conceived to be just as the name.

original: bcom ldan 'das mngon par bzhed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mngon par bzhed pa ma yin te /
translated: The Lord does not intend it so.

original: @313b ming ji lta ba bzhin don phyi rol lta bur ston par byed pa de bzhin du brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @313b ming ji lta ba bzhin don phyi rol lta bur ston par byed pa de bzhin du brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as the name is shown to be like an external object, just so the thing to be expressed and the expression do not exist.

original: 'dis kyang ming ji lta ba bzhin don du rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba sel ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang ming ji lta ba bzhin don du rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba sel ba yin no //
translated: This also removes the distraction of conceiving the meaning to be just as the name.

original: gang gi phyir 'ba' zhig gis brtags pa yin la brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ming de ni 'ga' zhig rjod par byed pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /🔽bden don rnam rtog sel ba na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'ba' zhig gis brtags pa yin la brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ming de ni 'ga' zhig rjod par byed pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni / bden don rnam rtog sel ba na /
translated: Because it is a mere designation, and because it is a designation, that name does not express anything at all.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is stated in the lines:🔽When the meaning of reality is conceived,

original: don las tha dad pa'i ming don bden pa'i don yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa sel ba na ste /
analyzed: don las tha dad pa'i ming don bden pa'i don yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa sel ba na ste /
translated: When the conception of a name that is different from the meaning is removed, the meaning of reality is conceived.

original: zlog pa na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: zlog pa na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: When he was refuted, the Lord said:

original: ci zhig gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci zhig gsungs she na /
translated: What did he say?

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa dang // sangs rgyas de bzhin byang chub sems //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa dang // sangs rgyas de bzhin byang chub sems //
translated: The perfection of wisdom, the Buddha, and the Bodhisattva

original: ming tsam zhes ni rab tu gsungs //
analyzed: ming tsam zhes ni rab tu gsungs //
translated: are said to be mere names.

original: zhes bstan pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par ro //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par ro //
translated: This is taught in the perfection of wisdom, which is the nature of the teaching.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pas de skad gsungs pa de'i ming gi sgra ni rang gi ngo bor yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pas de skad gsungs pa de'i ming gi sgra ni rang gi ngo bor yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the Tathagata said that, the sound of that name does not exist as its own nature.

original: 'dis ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming btags par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming btags par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the designations Buddha, Bodhisattva, and so on are mere names.

original: dgag pa 'dis gnyis med pa bsal ba yin no zhes bsam par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dgag pa 'dis gnyis med pa bsal ba yin no zhes bsam par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not think that this refutation eliminates non-duality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar 'di ni sgra don 'gog pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgra dang don dag 'gog par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni sgra don 'gog pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgra dang don dag 'gog par shes par bya'o //
translated: This is the refutation of the meaning of the sound and so on should be understood as the refutation of both the sound and its meaning.

original: dngos po sel bar byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin gnyis med pa'i shes pa ni sel bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po sel bar byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin gnyis med pa'i shes pa ni sel bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: “It does not eliminate the real” means that the nondual cognition of the nature of the real does not eliminate.

original: de ni sgrar med pa nyid kyis brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sgrar med pa nyid kyis brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is inexpressible by speech, since it is without speech.

original: da ni rigs pa 'di nyid gzhan du yang bsgre bar byed pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: da ni rigs pa 'di nyid gzhan du yang bsgre bar byed pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now, he states that this very reasoning is to be extended to other cases:

original: de bzhin du ni ngag gzhan la 'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni ngag gzhan la 'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “In the same way, in other statements as well.”

original: de bzhin du ni zhes bya ba ni sngar brjod pa'i don nges pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni zhes bya ba ni sngar brjod pa'i don nges pas so //
translated: “In the same way” means by the previously stated meaning.

original: ngag gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ngag la'o //
analyzed: ngag gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ngag la'o //
translated: “In other statements as well” means in statements of this kind.

original: don rnams nges par zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don gtan la phebs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don rnams nges par zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don gtan la phebs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “The meanings are to be ascertained” means that the meanings are to be established without error.

original: shes par bya zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes par bya zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: “One should understand” means one should realize.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yum las de kho na nyid rig pas ming thams cad yang dag par dmigs su med do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yum las de kho na nyid rig pas ming thams cad yang dag par dmigs su med do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines says, “The mother, the perfection of wisdom, is not apprehended by any name.”

original: ngag gi don nye bar bzung nas gsungs pa ni /🔽thams cad rig @314a * //
analyzed: ngag gi don nye bar bzung nas gsungs pa ni / thams cad rig @314a * //
translated: The meaning of the words is stated

original: pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: in “All things are known by the Omniscient One.”

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: There is no apprehension of them.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: yang dag tu ste don ji lta ba nyid du ma rig go //
analyzed: yang dag tu ste don ji lta ba nyid du ma rig go //
translated: They are not known in reality, in accordance with their meaning.

original: de ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: brjod pa ni ming rnams kun te rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni ming rnams kun te rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: “All names” are the expressions, the things that are expressed.

original: sus she na /
analyzed: sus she na /
translated: By whom?

original: thams cad rig pas te /🔽de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par rig pas de nyid rig pa ste //
analyzed: thams cad rig pas te / de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par rig pas de nyid rig pa ste //
translated: By the Omniscient One.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas so //
translated: The one who knows reality without error is the knower of reality, the Omniscient One.

original: gang gi phyir sgra dang don dag brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa nyid du bden pa'i don du mi dmigs pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir sgra ni zlog par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra dang don dag brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa nyid du bden pa'i don du mi dmigs pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir sgra ni zlog par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Since the words and their meanings are not apprehended as truly existent as the expressed and the expresser, therefore the words do not contradict the meaning.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pas gzung bar byed pa'i sgra ni zlog par byed cing 'gog par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pas gzung bar byed pa'i sgra ni zlog par byed cing 'gog par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The sounds that are apprehended by the auditory consciousness are not refuted or stopped.

original: 'di yang bstan par bya ba'i bsam pa'i ngor yin par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di yang bstan par bya ba'i bsam pa'i ngor yin par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood in terms of the intention to teach.

original: 'dis ni don ji lta ba bzhin ming du rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba bzlog par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni don ji lta ba bzhin ming du rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba bzlog par byas pa yin no //
translated: This is the avoidance of the distraction of conceptual thoughts about the name that corresponds to the object.

original: don gyi de kho na nyid thugs la gzhag par mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa 'pho ba las /
analyzed: don gyi de kho na nyid thugs la gzhag par mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa 'pho ba las /
translated: Having set the reality of the object in his mind, the Blessed One said in the Lakṣaṇāparibhāṣā:

original: ming ni gang dang gang gis ni //
analyzed: ming ni gang dang gang gis ni //
translated: Whatever name there is

original: chos ni gang dang gang brjod pa //
analyzed: chos ni gang dang gang brjod pa //
translated: for whatever dharma,

original: de ni de la yod min te //
analyzed: de ni de la yod min te //
translated: that does not exist in that.

original: 'di ni chos rnams chos nyid do //🔽ming ni ming gi rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: 'di ni chos rnams chos nyid do // ming ni ming gi rang bzhin gyis //
translated: This is the reality of dharmas.🔽Name is empty of the nature of name.

original: stong ste ming ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: stong ste ming ni yod ma yin //
translated: Name does not exist.

original: ming med pa yi chos rnams kun //
analyzed: ming med pa yi chos rnams kun //
translated: All dharmas that are without name

original: ming rnams nyid kyis yongs bstan byas //
analyzed: ming rnams nyid kyis yongs bstan byas //
translated: are indicated by names.

original: 'di dag thams cad ming tsam ste //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ming tsam ste //
translated: All this is mere name,

original: 'du shes tsam la rab tu gnas //
analyzed: 'du shes tsam la rab tu gnas //
translated: established in mere conception.

original: rjod byed las ni gzhan gyur pa //
analyzed: rjod byed las ni gzhan gyur pa //
translated: The expressed is different from the expression.

original: brjod par bya ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba yod ma yin //
translated: The expressed does not exist.

original: zhes gsungs so //🔽'dri bar byed pa thams cad 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis ka gsal bar gyur pa de bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni rab 'byor gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // 'dri bar byed pa thams cad 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis ka gsal bar gyur pa de bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni rab 'byor gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rab 'byor gyis ni rjod byed nyid du 'dod pa'i sgra dang brjod bya nyid du 'dod pa'i sgra'i don gnyis ka 'gog cing sel ba na'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis ni rjod byed nyid du 'dod pa'i sgra dang brjod bya nyid du 'dod pa'i sgra'i don gnyis ka 'gog cing sel ba na'o //
translated: All questions are answered by the noble Subhūti, who is clear about both the perfection of wisdom and its explanation. He says, “Subhūti, when both the sound that is asserted to be the expression and the meaning of the sound that is asserted to be the expressed are stopped and eliminated,🔽how is it, Subhūti, that the perfection of wisdom is taught?”

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: rab 'byor de'i sa byang chub sems dpa'i ming dang de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ma mthong ngo zhes ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par brjod par gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de'i sa byang chub sems dpa'i ming dang de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ma mthong ngo zhes ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par brjod par gyur te /
translated: Subhūti, the name of that stage and likewise the bodhisattva are not seen. Thus the perfection of wisdom is taught.

original: smras par gyur te gnyis ka yang kun brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes bsam pa'o //
analyzed: smras par gyur te gnyis ka yang kun brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes bsam pa'o //
translated: It is said that both are imagined. This is the thought.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don nye bar sdud pa'i thabs kyis sgra gzhan nyid tsam yin yang ngag gi don rtogs pa nyid do zhes ston par byed pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don nye bar sdud pa'i thabs kyis sgra gzhan nyid tsam yin yang ngag gi don rtogs pa nyid do zhes ston par byed pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement that teaches this is:

original: shes rab pha rol phyin ngag gang //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin ngag gang //
translated: The statement of the perfection of wisdom

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so forth.

original: ji skad brjod zin pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu @314b phyin pa de dang 'brel ba'i ngag gang zhig 'di tsam gyis rtogs pa min pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad brjod zin pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu @314b phyin pa de dang 'brel ba'i ngag gang zhig 'di tsam gyis rtogs pa min pa ste /
translated: The statement that is connected with the perfection of wisdom as previously explained is not understood by this alone.

original: ma bshad cing rnam par ma phye ba de ni med cing mi srid kyi /
analyzed: ma bshad cing rnam par ma phye ba de ni med cing mi srid kyi /
translated: It does not exist and is not possible without explanation and analysis.

original: 'on kyang rnam grangs gzhan du brjod pa'i ngag thams cad nyid kyang don rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam grangs gzhan du brjod pa'i ngag thams cad nyid kyang don rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: However, all statements expressed in other enumerations are the very understanding of the meaning.

original: ji ltar don rtogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar don rtogs she na /
translated: How is the meaning understood?

original: brjod pa 'di tsam gyis te /
analyzed: brjod pa 'di tsam gyis te /
translated: By this mere expression.

original: ji skad brjod zin pa'i bshad pa'i sgo nas so //🔽'on kyang 'di dag de shes pa //
analyzed: ji skad brjod zin pa'i bshad pa'i sgo nas so // 'on kyang 'di dag de shes pa //
translated: By the previously explained explanation.🔽However, these are to be analyzed

original: rnams kyis zhib mo'i blo yis dpyod //
analyzed: rnams kyis zhib mo'i blo yis dpyod //
translated: by those who know them with a subtle mind.

original: ces bya ba la dpyod ces bya ba ni brtag par bya ba ste nges par bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la dpyod ces bya ba ni brtag par bya ba ste nges par bsams pa'o //
translated: The word examine means to investigate, to think carefully.

original: gang dag ce na /
analyzed: gang dag ce na /
translated: What is it that is to be examined?

original: 'di dag ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ste /
translated: It is these:

original: sgra gzhan gyis brjod pa dag la yang yod pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid can rnams so //
analyzed: sgra gzhan gyis brjod pa dag la yang yod pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid can rnams so //
translated: The thirty-two characteristics that exist in the expressions of others.

original: su dag gis she na /
analyzed: su dag gis she na /
translated: Who is it that examines them?

original: de shes pa rnams kyis te ngag gi don shes pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de shes pa rnams kyis te ngag gi don shes pa rnams kyis so //
translated: It is those who know them, those who know the meaning of speech.

original: de dag ji ltar dpyad par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar dpyad par bya zhe na /
translated: How are they to be examined?

original: brjod pa zhib mo'i blo yis te //
analyzed: brjod pa zhib mo'i blo yis te //
translated: By the mind of subtle expression.

analyzed: shin tu phra ba'i blo yul gzhan du ma chags pa dang bral ba'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: by a consciousness that is free from attachment to other objects of a very subtle mind.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gzugs brnyan gyi sgra thos pas da ni de'i don ston par byed pa ni /
translated: Having heard the sound of the reflection of the perfection of wisdom, now the meaning of that is being taught:

analyzed: skabs kyi don ni spong ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the context is abandonment, etc.

original: skabs zhes bya ba ni gnyug ma la brjod de /
analyzed: skabs zhes bya ba ni gnyug ma la brjod de /
translated: The word context refers to the original.

analyzed: gnyug ma'i skabs su bab pa'i don de spong zhing gzhag pa ste de yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / don gzhan rtogs pa gang yin pa zhes so sor nges pa'i don las don gzhan rtogs shing 'god pa dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthong zhing thos pa de ni gzugs brnyan yin par 'dod do //
translated: The one who rejects and does not hold to the meaning that is present in the innate, and who realizes and posits a meaning that is other than the meaning that is ascertained individually, that one sees and hears the perfection of wisdom as a reflection.

original: gzugs brnyan ni ltar bcos bu ste /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ni ltar bcos bu ste /
translated: A reflection is a counterfeit.

original: gser bcos bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: gser bcos bu lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a counterfeit of gold.

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
translated: The word “even” has the sense of “because.”🔽Because of that, the one who explains the meaning that is present in the innate and who holds to a meaning that is other than that is said to be a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang gi phyir gang zhig skabs kyi don 'chad par byas pa dang gang yang don gzhan 'dzin pa ni thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gzugs brnyan gyi sgras brjod do zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zhig skabs kyi don 'chad par byas pa dang gang yang don gzhan 'dzin pa ni thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gzugs brnyan gyi sgras brjod do zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the summary.

analyzed: 'di nyid la dgongs nas shing rta chen po rnams kyis /
translated: With this very point in mind, the great trailblazers have said:

original: 'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
analyzed: 'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
translated: There is nothing at all to be removed from this,

original: gzhan par bya bya ba chung zad med //
analyzed: gzhan par bya bya ba chung zad med //
translated: There is no other action to be done.

original: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //🔽yang dag mthong na rnam par grol //
analyzed: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta // yang dag mthong na rnam par grol //
translated: See reality in reality.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you see reality, you are liberated.

original: da ni don gyi mjug bsdu ba bsdus te ston par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: da ni don gyi mjug bsdu ba bsdus te ston par brjod pa ni /
translated: Now, the summary of the meaning is stated in brief:

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rten can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the basis.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya par bgrangs pa thams cad la yang gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rten can gyi bsdus don 'di tsam nyid yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya par bgrangs pa thams cad la yang gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rten can gyi bsdus don 'di tsam nyid yin te /
translated: In all the enumerations of the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, this much alone is the summarized meaning based on the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i ming can yin gyi lhag par gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it has the name endowed with the thirty-two characteristics, and there is nothing else beyond that.

original: 'on kyang slar yang de nyid ni bzlas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang slar yang de nyid ni bzlas pa yin te /
translated: However, it is repeated again:

original: yang nas yang du bskyar ba yin no //
analyzed: yang nas yang du bskyar ba yin no //
translated: It is repeated again and again.

original: don de ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: don de ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning like?

analyzed: brjod pa don gzhan la brten nas te / don gzhan gyi sgras ni @315a * //
translated: Based on another meaning, that is, based on another word.

analyzed: 'dri ba gzhan brjod de / gang gi tshe dri ba po'i dbye bas 'di lta ste /
translated: Another word expresses another question.

translated: When, by the division of the questioner, thus, the aggregates, the factors of enlightenment, the qualities of the Buddha, etc. are based on another question, at that time, that very thing is repeated again and again.

translated: Or, based on another meaning to be taught for those who delight in the concise, that very thing, the meaning of reality characterized by thirty-two, is repeated either individually or in its entirety.

translated: Now, in order to show the vastness of the self, it is said that the accumulation of merit that is fit for action from composing the Compendium of the Perfection of Wisdom dedicates the merit.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin ma ni //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin ma ni //
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin ma ni brgyad stong zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i rang bzhin brgyad stong par bgrangs pa'o //🔽yang dag tu ni bsdus pa yin //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin ma ni brgyad stong zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i rang bzhin brgyad stong par bgrangs pa'o // yang dag tu ni bsdus pa yin //
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines is so called because it is counted as having eight thousand topics.🔽It is truly collected

original: zhes bya ba ni don bsdus pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don bsdus pa byas pa'o //
translated: means that it is compiled in meaning.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: yang dag ces bya ba ste phyin ci ma log par ro //
analyzed: yang dag ces bya ba ste phyin ci ma log par ro //
translated: Truly means unerringly.

original: thob ces bya ba ni rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: thob ces bya ba ni rnyed pa'o //
translated: Obtained means found.

original: ci thob ce na /🔽bsod nams te /
analyzed: ci thob ce na / bsod nams te /
translated: What is obtained?🔽Merit.

original: de dag par byed pas na bsod nams te /
